page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: area. Near Drysgeirch Mill there was a woolen factory. Gelly-Gatrog Farm is believed to date back to Elizabethan times. The present house of Ffrwd is the third house on this site. There is a wall still standing of the first house where a tudor rose is depicted on the plaster. Pontantwn at one time was a thriving village with a smithy, post office, taylor's shop, public house, mills etc., but at present it is mainly residential. A toll gate was burnt in this area during the Rebecca riots. It is believed that one of the leaders lived nearby.
